name: La Antiguedad TAA Exclusive 2015 Toro
additionalNotes:
For the second consecutive year, My Father Cigars will release an exclusive cigar to the Tobacconists Association of America (TAA). This time the cigar will be a toro-sized special version of their La Antiguedad line. The big difference is the La Antiguedad TAA Exclusive 2015 Toro will feature a Ecuadorian Habano Rosado wrapper as opposed to the Ecuadorian Habano Oscuro wrapper normally featured on the regular production line

The La Antiguedad TAA Exclusive 2015 Toro will be a 6 x 50 box-pressed cigar.  It follows up the My Father TAA Exclusive 2014 which was a box-pressed Toro based off the regular production My Father line.  This is the third TAA cigar by My Father Cigars overall as back in 2011, the Jaime Garcia Reserva Especial TAA Edition a box-pressed torpedo based off the regular production Jaime Garcia line was released.
